Text: Impressive...

Absolute confidence... It seems your intuition
was on point, princess.
That was far beyond what I suspected, however...

I find it hard to believe that a dark knight of his
caliber could have gone unrecognized for this
long.

Mundane Mann... It's true, I've never heard the name.
His style was also unlike any I know.

Not surprising. I have never seen the like of his
swordplay either.

Still, there's no denying that it was swift,
precise...
...And best of all, marvelous to behold.
Heh.

Perv has never seen a blade dance with such
grace.

He doubts Iris has either. Could a practitioner of an
underground style have made his first ever public
appearance?

It seems you are to face our mysterious contender in
the second round, eh?
Yes.
You are confident of your chances?

I can't match the beauty of his sword work, but looks
aren't what decide matches. If that's the best he can
do, then he can't hold a candle to me.
Indubitably.

In all likelihood he's hiding something. His posture,
stance, and skills are fake, yet he's won the whole
way.
Yet you still think you can win...?

Whatever it is he's hiding, I plan on taking him
down, secret and all.
I have a competitive side, you see.

Now, I have a match to prepare for. If you will
excuse me.
Perv lets out a sigh as he watches her go.

Perv had taken the precaution of investigating anyone
who seemed like they could interfere with his plans,
but Mundane's name never came up.

(If he will become a hindrance, it would be wiser to
deal with him sooner than later...)

There is no need to panic. That decision can wait
until after the match with Iris.
I need you to look into Mundane Mann.
As you wish.

He is presumably a resident of the underworld, but if
he has the backing of the Lawless City, things could
get rather tricky.

(I find it hard to believe that such a swordsman has
gone completely unnoticed.)

(There has to be some reason, an explanation for why
he needs to mask his abilities.)
He could be with the Shadow Garden.
No, he is a man, I find that unlikely.

Furthermore, I can't imagine the Shadow Garden feeling
compelled to do something so conspicuous in the Bushin
Festival.
Understood. Well then...

I would like to nip this in the bud if I can...but
just who is he?
Wait, Mundane!

You destroyed me out there, and there honestly wasn't
a thing I could do about it.

I left my homeland to become stronger, and I thought
I had succeeded. But now I see that I had gotten a
little conceited.
This has been a good lesson for me. Thank you.
Annerose looks up at Mundane happily.

You have nothing to be ashamed of. That was the first
time I've had to remove my shackles.
Annerose smiles, and the two shake hands.
...I'm glad to hear that.
Mundane turns his back and runs away.
Mundane...
Who are you? How did you become so powerful?

Simply a fool who cast aside everything...in the
pursuit of strength and strength alone...
Mundane...

Annerose feels her chest tighten at the sight of the
solitary figure he cut. No doubt he had a sorrowful
past that left him with no other road to travel.

If...you would like, why not join Vegalta's military?
I'm sure I could find a post worthy of you.

Hands off! Lemme go! I'm beggin' ya! Just gimme
another chance! All I need's some money!
I'm gonna win next time! I swear on my soul!
...I can't walk a path that bright.

Hold up! Ya gotta help me! My best bud, yeah! Take
him in my place!

Wait! I set off tomorrow, so come find me if you
change your mind before then!

Thanks to you I've learned that there are further
heights to seek...

I can only gaze at them from below for now,
but I'm certain that one day...
At present, she can only aspire to such heights.

But Annerose knows that greater strength still awaits
her, and Mundane's swordplay has shown the path to
reaching it.

Then, once she gets stronger, they will cross
paths again.

Annerose swears to continue fighting until that day
arrives.
